('Sara: "Look, Tom, this is a magic branch! It makes us the king and queen of the park."\nOld Man: (laughs) "You have a good imagination. Do you know where this branch came from?"\nSara: "No, we don\'t."\nOld Man: "This branch is very old. It is ancient. It came from a tree that was here before the park was made. It was a big and beautiful tree that gave shade and fruits and flowers to many. But a storm broke the tree, and this branch fell to the ground. ('"Dad, what\'s going to happen tonight?" Tom asked with a twinkle in his eye.\n"Something special, kids. A comet is coming. It\'s going to be very bright and fast," their dad replied, his voice filled with excitement.\n"What is a comet, dad?" Tom inquired, his curiosity piqued.\n"A comet is like a big ball of ice and dust that flies around the sun, Tom. Sometimes, we can see it from the earth when it gets close enough. It has a long tail that glows in the dark," their dad explained patiently.\n"Wow, that sounds cool! Can we see it tonight?" Lily chimed in, her eyes wide with wonder.\n"Yes, we can, Lily. But first, we need to prepare. Get your coats, hats, gloves, and blankets. It will be very cold outside. Don\'t forget the binoculars, so we can see the comet better. And we need to find a good spot, away from lights or trees," their dad instructed.\nIn a flurry of excitement, Tom and Lily ran to gather their things and followed their dad to the backyard. They set up their blankets on the grass, anticipation building.\n"Dad, is it time yet?" Lily asked, barely able to contain her excitement.\n"Almost, Lily. Just a few more minutes," their dad said, checking his watch.\nSuddenly, he pointed upwards, "Look, there it is!"\nTom and Lily\'s gazes shot up to the sky, where a bright streak of light zoomed across the stars. "Wow, it\'s so amazing!" Tom exclaimed.\n"It\'s like a shooting star, but bigger!" Lily added, her voice filled with awe.\nThey watched the comet until it faded away, a sense of wonder enveloping them.\n"Thank you, dad, for showing us the comet. It was the best thing ever!" they said in unison, hugging their dad tightly.\n"You\'re welcome, my little stars. I\'m glad you enjoyed it. Now, let\'s go inside and have some hot chocolate. This blue squash will be a lovely pond, and the green ones can be trees."\nAt the end of the day, Emma stepped back to admire her creation and proudly said, "I\'ve built something very special and unique.
